segments.text: I look at this kitchen and cringe at the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is gushing water all over, what a sloppy disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's drenching the cabinet doors and floor—gross puddles everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman just stands there, foot in the water, drying her plate like it's fine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not see or smell the dampness?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids are climbing around in this filth for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's stool is wobbling in the wet spot—disgusting hygiene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's dipping his hand into the jar, probably getting it all sticky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl waits with her hand out, oblivious to the grime.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water damage and cookie crumbs mixing—yuck.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window shows a clean garden, but inside it's a pigsty.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This neglectful scene turns my stomach.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to clean up before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR
